page.title: 01A SECOND DOMESDAY BLOCK
page.content: Our second block of Domesday land is chiefly agricultural.It lies to the east of the school and runs down towards the River Witham.In summer time the main trunk road carries holiday traffic to the coast.There are a few farm houses and scattered cottages.The secondary roads lead off to Bardney.The land is rather poor clay soil so it is used for forestry instead of farm land.There is a site of a Medieval Priory founded by Gilbert of Sempringham.If you walk along by the edge of the wood you will find the humps and mounds of the foundations of an Abbey or Priory.
